channel.title: Home Network Suggestions
channel.description: Ok, getting to the point. Currently im setting up a CAT6 home network, and I need some suggestions here. Mainly this is going to support a home server and other fucking pointless shit. I just got done running CAT6 to the attic and now im reading to start putting it all togther. Currently there is 15 cables that im working with. I need 3 for the cameras which will be outside, and the rest are for the office, living room, bonus room, bedrooms, and etc. What I need suggestions are is a a router, networking cabinet, highquality durable outdoor cameras, and cable modem suggestions.

item.title: Home Network Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:5, topic:325877”][quote author=c|p link=topic=422287.msg3100913#msg3100913 date=1263697180]
why so paranoid
[/quote]

There is sometimes crime in our neighborhood.[/quote]
Trouble in your neighbourhood?

Sorry, I have a problem. =[

Read full topic

item.title: Home Network Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Why not just use a Gigabit switch instead of a whole rack filled full of hardware that is certain to be overkill for your needs?

I want to leave room for improvement. But over the years my networking knowledge has been cripplied because of improper labeling of hardware. So what hardware will I need to do the following. I have one cable connection.

So here is what I have currently.

One incoming cable connetion
One Motoral SB6120 http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16825122009&cm_re=Motorola_Modem--25-122-009--Product
15 Cat6 Drops

I need internet access on all of these connections and I need wireless.

So this is the only way I have been able to get it to work before. Modem to Wireless Router, Router to Switch/Hub, then Switch/Hub to computers.

Whats the best way to go about doing my setup or am I making any sense at all?

Read full topic

item.title: Home Network Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

good cooling, fire extinguishers and a couple of 1gbit switches. For the cameras, get any standard webcam into a pico itx board.

Read full topic

item.title: Home Network Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

router: m0n0wall and variants
modem: pretty much anything not cheap
cabinet: could just get a generic metal frame with shelves and put switches inside

Read full topic
